intro: Manulea longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved manulea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals, and are clustered in inflorescences. Manulea longifolia is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats, preferring well-drained soils.
